alert.note: Alert for Manitowoc (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 16 at 8:10PM CDT by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Manitowoc County through 900 PM CDT... At 809 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Brillion, or 17 miles southeast of Appleton, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Valders around 825 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Manitowoc. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
